page.title: 02CLIMATE
page.content: The annual rainfall for the area is 1034mm and the annual range of temperature varies from 3 to 15 degrees Centigrade from January to July. Hard frost and heavy snow in winter is exceptional because of the low relief and close proximity of the area to the Atlantic Ocean. The prevailing winds are westerly, blowing from this direction 80% of the year. This brings a succession of low pressure areas from the North Atlantic throughout the year making the weather very unpredictable. The high rainfall causes a lot of soil leaching and washing out of agro chemicals which is gradually polluting streams and rivers in the area, however, the mild winters and high rainfall together produce rich pastures for the dairy farms which lie to the west of the town.
